result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael B. Youngthunder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs Payable as follows:  $50.00 per month, starting on or before June 1, 2016 and on the same day each month thereafter, until paid in full.  Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
EMP allowed, according to jail rules.  Start on or before July 1, 2016 at 6:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Michael B. Youngthunder
Current: PO Box 111, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 09-07-2016)
Prior: W8996 Pettibone Pass, Black River Falls, WI 54615

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  Defendant plead to DC, domestic, without repeater enhancer, and to criminal damage to property as charged.  State recommending 20 days jail, concurrent.  Defense is free to argue. Victim notification complied with.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties of the charges he is pleading to.  Defendant plead no contest to each.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of domestic disorderly conduct and criminal damage to property.  State recommended 20 days jail, concurrent.  Defense recommended 10 days jail.  60 days to report.  $50/mo payment plan for court costs.  Court ordered: 20 days jail, concurrent.  EMP allowed according to jail rules.   Start on or July 1, 2016 at 6 pm.  Pay court costs @ $50.00 per month starting 6/1/16.
Per T.D. of DA's Office - she will email a copy to the Judge

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  Reading of information waived.  Defendant stood mute.  Court advised the charges and possible penalties.  Court entered NGP on both counts.  PTC set for 9/2/15 and  STC 9/16/15 at 4:00 pm

same appearances.  Attorney Ritland requests the no contact be lifted.  State argues against.  May change to   No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with: J.H.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  State called Officer C.E., sworn by clerk.  Witness questioned by the State.  Witness identified the defendant.  Exhibit 1 offered by State.  Defense stipulates to admission of exhibits 1 and 2 for the purposes of this hearing.  Admitted.  Attorney Ritland questioned witness.  Attorney Ritland requested that the court not find probable cause.  State moves for a bind over.  Court finds probable cause.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference at 05-06-2015 10:00 am

Court advised the defendant the charges and possible penalties.  Court questioned defendant of his understanding of the wavier of time limits.  Defendant stated he understood the waiver of time limits.  Court found defendant waived the time limit for the preliminary hearing to be held.  PTC set.  Attorney Ritland requested a bond modification of the no contact provision.  ADA Inlow objected.  Court denied.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person.  Attorney James Ritland appeared specially.  Defendant needs time to retain Attorney Ritland.  Attorney requested that the no contact provision of the bond be lifted.  ADA Inlow objected.  Bond continued as previously ordered.  Defendant to contact SPD or retain Attorney Ritland by the AIA set for 4/20/15 at 10:30 am.
